lusc.net.github

Class Matrix2DOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • lusc.net.github.Matrix2DOperations

  • public class Matrix2DOperations
extends java.lang.Object
    This class facilitates some matrix functions, especially on spectrograms. It is called by Song in particular. Most of the functions here are not currently being used, but may be useful in the future for automatic detection of elements in a spectrogram, or similar purposes. Most functions are not highly optimized!
    Author:
    Rob

      This method is an effort to enhance the distinctiveness of signals in a spectrogram.
      int[][] makeKernels(int rad1)
      This method constructs a set of convolution kernels of set radius, consisting of different primitive lines.

      • enhanceDistinctiveness

        public float[][] enhanceDistinctiveness(double wei,
                               int p1,
                               int p2,
                               float maxCh,
                               int anx,
                               int ny,
                               float[][] out)
        This method is an effort to enhance the distinctiveness of signals in a spectrogram. It isn't used at present
        Parameters:
        wei - degree of enhancement
        p1 - radius of a kernel
        p2 - radius of a second kernel
        maxCh -
        Returns:
        a float[][] of same size as the spectrogram

      • convolve

        public float[][] convolve(float[][] data,
                 double[][] kernel,
                 int rad)
        This method convolves a data object (typically from Song) and a kernel.
        Parameters:
        data - typically, spectrogram float[][] data
        kernel - a convolution kernel
        rad - kernel radius
        Returns:
        a float[][] of same dimensions as data, which has been convolved

      • makeKernels

        public int[][] makeKernels(int rad1)
        This method constructs a set of convolution kernels of set radius, consisting of different primitive lines.
        Parameters:
        rad1 - kernel radius
        Returns:
        int[][] of a kernel
